alert.note: Alert for City of Richmond; Henrico (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 9:00AM EST until further notice by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Locks affecting City of Richmond and Henrico County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia... James River At Richmond Westham affecting City of Richmond, Henrico and Chesterfield Counties. For the Lower James Basin...including Richmond Locks, Cartersville, Richmond Westham...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River at Richmond Locks. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Water is entering Dock Street. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:54 AM EST Friday the stage was 9.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 8.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:54 AM EST Friday was 13.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling today, dropping below flood stage by tonight. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.5 feet on 04/18/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 9 pm EST tonight.this evening at 900 PM EST.
